title: Blackburn Park Road F.C.
text:
Blackburn Park Road F.C. was a <a href="association%20football">football</a> team formed in <a href="1875%20in%20association%20football">1875</a>. They played in <a href="Blackburn">Blackburn</a>, Lancashire, near to the railway station.
For a few years in the 1880s they entered the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a>, then known as the English Cup. Despite some good results they were rarely a match for the two major town teams of that time: <a href="Blackburn%20Rovers%20F.C.">Blackburn Rovers</a> and <a href="Blackburn%20Olympic%20F.C.">Blackburn Olympic</a>. In <a href="1883-84%20in%20English%20football">1883–84</a> they beat Clitheroe Low Moor 6–0, before losing narrowly (2–3) to one of the region's best teams, <a href="Accrington%20F.C.">Accrington</a>. They played for four seasons in the <a href="Lancashire%20Combination">Lancashire Combination</a>, without ever finishing in the top half of the table. On 17 October 1885 they were beaten 2–1 at Scottish side <a href="Third%20Lanark%20A.C.">Third Lanark</a> in the F.A. Cup. In <a href="1887-88%20in%20English%20football">1887–88</a> they beat <a href="Northern%20Ireland">(Northern) Irish</a> invitee <a href="Lisburn%20Distillery%20F.C.">(Lisburn) Distillery</a> 2–1 in the FA Cup, but were disqualified and Distillery advanced.
Eventually the club ran out of money and had to disband.
